Summary Recruited by Intel out of Texas upon graduating in Microcomputer Technology.  
 
Since joining Intel I have enjoyed working on several roles in manufacturing, logistics, customer service, warehousing, IT and project management. These experiences have given me the opportunity to travel to Intel's sites all over the world. 
 
Upon receiving my Bachelor's degree I moved into Intel's IT division supporting several logistics software tools. This experience was complemented by supporting new software implementations both as a subject matter expert and as project lead.  
 
I have significant experience in people management. I have collected great knowledge in managing Intel's main non finished goods distribution center, finished goods warehousing operations and logistics support teams in Arizona, New Mexico and Costa Rica.  
 
Obtaining my MBA allowed me to grow my knowledge and scope. I currently work as a project manager and business analyst supporting projects in systems, 3PL warehousing, B2B and SAP among others. The experience is great since the teams I lead are global in scope and membership. I look forward to seeing what the future has for me.

Summary I am a Business Analyst for Chevron, one of the world's leading integrated energy companies. In this role I am responsible for creating and maintaining the partnership between business needs and technology delivery for the Global Mfg. Apps and Reporting team by leading projects and providing application support while identifying practical and cost-effective business solutions.  
 
Before joining Chevron, I worked for multiple global companies — General Electric, The Walt Disney World Company, Klockner Pentaplast, and Intel. 
 
I’m truly passionate about my work and always eager to connect with other change makers. While I enjoy all aspects of my job, I think my favorite stage of a project is building genuine relationships with the client or business unit leader in an effort to fully understand his or her business objectives.  
 
I have both a Bachelor and Master of Science degree in Industrial and Systems Engineering from Virginia Tech and North Carolina A&T State University, respectively.
